intro: Sherbournia hapalophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is a perennial shrub that produces small, white or pale pink flowers, attracting various pollinators.
